subject: Productivity
title: Email Transforms Communication
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Email Transforms Communication.

hook.text: The first email was sent in 1971. By 2023, over 300 billion emails are sent every single day.

buildup.text: Email replaced memos, faxes, and phone tag. Asynchronous communication became the default.

discovery.text: Email made global business coordination possible. A message sent at midnight arrives by morning.

twist.text: Cal Newport calls email a productivity disaster. It created an obligation to respond constantly.

climax.text: Email solved the communication problem and created the interruption problem in the same stroke.

punchline.text: Email freed us from the fax and chained us to the inbox.

quiz.question: How many emails are sent daily as of 2023?
